title: Sierra Space and U.S. military to explore using Dream Chaser for point-to-point cargo delivery
summary: Sierra Space signed an agreement with the U.S. Transportation Command to explore using Dream Chaser for point-to-point delivery of military cargo

title: SpaceX planning two weekend launches in Florida
summary: The 39th and 40th launches of the year from Florida’s Space Coast are set to blast off Saturday night and Sunday night, back-to-back missions to deploy more satellites for SpaceX’s Starlink internet network.

title: SciTec wins $272 million Space Force contract for data analytics software
summary: SciTec, a small business based in Princeton, New Jersey, won a $272 million contract to develop software to analyze data collected by the U.S. military’s early-warning infrared satellites.

title: U.S. to introduce U.N. resolution on ASAT testing ban
summary: The United States will introduce a resolution at the United Nations General Assembly this month calling for a halt on direct-ascent anti-satellite (ASAT) testing.

title: Commerce and Defense Departments sign agreement on space traffic management cooperation
summary: The Departments of Commerce and Defense have signed an agreement to cooperate on transferring responsibility for civil and commercial space traffic management.
